pros: A good place to work, with so many policies and strict guidelines.

review_title: High Intensity learning within a short period
pros: You learn quickly, and they let you work in a sector you haven't before. Managers understand and give time for problem-solving and give credit for their work.
cons: A lot of work, so overburdened most of the time

pros: It's diverse ans people have warm engagements. RCTs are the norm and I have learnt to think more critically about change and data quality. A really good place to build your experience in research Impact Evaluation and RCTs.
cons: Work load can be to heavy for people resulting into longer working hours in a single day, but payment for all this seems to be incomparably low.

pros: Dynamic work environment, very smart people, great for young people seeking field experience, diversifying *slightly* more beyond aspiring econ phds, you learn a ton not just with Stata but overall project management skills way more than I would expect in a different position
cons: High RA turnover, admin not the smoothest, safety not as highly prioritized in Uganda as it should be, HQ disconnect, some PIs are brutal, RMs usually stretched thin

pros: Great exposure to on the ground academic field work and see how randomized controlled trials are conducted in practice. Good opportunity to brush up on Stata skills while managing data flow and good experience to work/live in a developing country.
cons: Can be a bit overwhelming managing the data flow process in the field. Learning curve is steep and need to be able to learn fast.

review_title: Excellent work place with some downsides
pros: Great environment, especially the country office where I worked.  The work is very interesting and ranges from office work to in the field experience. Own initiative is valued and it is a wonderful learning experience.
cons: Workload can be a lot at times so this should be rewarded. Management from the US/head office is non existent.
